result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CHARLES W ROHR

records.addlTxt:
2:45 PM Defendant CHARLES W ROHR not in court.  Attorney Edmund Jelinski in court for CHARLES W ROHR.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy Ann Paider in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jelinski to file waiver of appearance with the court within 10 days or warrant will be issued.  Requests adjournment for more time to prepare for jury trial.  No objection from the State. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JOC - not deliverable as addressed, unable to forward

records.addlTxt: You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7).  Contact (920) 236-4906 IMMEDIATELY after your hearing to schedule an appointment.  You must bring your court hearing paperwork to your appointment. No contact with V1.

9:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CHARLES W ROHR in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Given/has complaint. Waive reading. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings. Defendant requests attorney - Attorney Jelinski appointed.  Recommendation:  24 mos. probation or 6 months jail and restitution.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
